description: The Simple CNN model is a straightforward convolutional neural network designed for basic image classification tasks. It consists of a series of convolutional layers followed by pooling layers, and fully connected layers, making it suitable for small to medium-sized datasets. This model is easy to implement and serves as a foundational approach for learning and experimenting with CNN architectures.

metrics.inference_time: 2 ms per image on NVIDIA GTX 1080

dependencies.software_dependencies: TensorFlow, Keras, OpenCV, NumPy, Pillow, Matplotlib
dependencies.hardware_requirements: GPU (NVIDIA GTX 1080 or similar recommended), CPU

limitations:
- May not perform well on highly complex or large-scale datasets.
- Limited in handling high-resolution images or fine-grained classification tasks.
- Performance is highly dependent on the quality of the training data and may require extensive hyperparameter tuning.
